key_points: President Joe Biden ordered the creation of a cyber review board and new software standards for government agencies.
The order is in response to a series of digital intrusions that have impacted the United States.
The cyber review board is modeled after the National Transportation Safety Board, which investigates plane crashes.
New security standards for software bought by government agencies will be developed.
The initiative was partly triggered by a digital extortion attempt against Colonial Pipeline.
The order aims to prevent incidents like the hack of Texas software company SolarWinds.
Kiersten Todt, managing director of the Cyber Readiness Institute, praised the software rules as potentially game-changing.
The executive order mandates the use of multi-factor authentication and encryption for data and communications.
Recent hacks have exploited vulnerabilities in software made by companies like Microsoft and Ivanti.
Senator Mark Warner called the executive order a good first step but highlighted the need for further Congressional action.
spokespersons: Kiersten Todt (Managing Director, Cyber Readiness Institute)
Senator Mark Warner (Democrat, Chair of the Senate Intelligence Committee)
